overview.qripto: Qripto is a set of Quantum-Ready Internet protocols that make data, identity, and payments agent-first and privacy-preserving. It centers on iQubes (secure information containers), Aigents (AI agents), COYN ($QOYN) for broader value flows, and QriptoCENT (Qc), a cent-pegged micro-stablecoin engineered for ultra-fine, agent-to-agent commerce.

faq.a: A cent-pegged, agent-native micro-stablecoin (1 Qc = US $0.01) with sub-cent precision, designed for tiny programmable payments across media and agentic commerce.

faq.q: How does Qc differ from $1 stablecoins?
faq.a: Qc prices micro-moments naturally (e.g., $0.001–$0.09), supports anti-spam tolls, and encodes splits/limits in iQubes; $1 units are too coarse for such interactions.
Cryptographically bound containers for data, content, tools, models, and agents (5 primitives) with metaQube/BlakQube/tokenQube entanglement and fine-grained access.
An agent-to-agent (A2A) standard for payments and iQube transfers, often used with DVN for cross-chain movement.

faq.q: Where do metaKnyts and 21 Sats fit?
faq.a: They are the storyworld onboarding channel for the Quantum-Ready Internet; users unlock transmissions and, soon, the graphic novel using Knight COYN and Qc.
Creators set Qc prices for unlocks/comments/DMs; x402 settles instantly; iQube policies auto-split revenue and manage access.

faq.q: Can I move Qc across chains?
faq.a: Yes, via DVN/x402 using canonical sends, deferred minting, or remote custody, each with different trade-offs.
Yes—privacy by design with iQubes and DiDQube/KybeDID. You control what is shared.

glossary.iQubes: Secure, token-controlled containers for data, content, tools, models, and agents.
glossary.BlakQube: Private payload component of an iQube.
glossary.tokenQube: Tokenized access key component of an iQube.
glossary.x402: Agent-to-agent payments and iQube transfer standard.
glossary.KybeDID: Durable root identity concept that can bind mutable operational DIDs.
glossary.HFT: High-frequency trading; here, per-signal micro-settlement and experimentation.

qriptomedia.title: QriptoMedia - Micropayments for Media
flows: Pay-per-unlock for pages, panels, clips, or bonus lore (e.g., metaKnyts transmissions)
Pay-per-comment / pay-per-DM: combats spam, values attention
Tip-to-highlight: fans elevate panels/scenes; creators see demand signals
Auto-splits: revenue splits across collaborators via iQube policy; no spreadsheets
Stream-to-own: accrue micro-ownership rights via ongoing Qc micro-payments
qriptomedia.why_qc: Sub-cent pricing lets you charge $0.001–$0.07-type amounts naturally (0.1–7 Qc), perfect for frictionless media moments.

hft.title: HFT & Qc - Micro-lot Experimentation
features: Micro-lot experimentation: run per-signal wagers at 0.1–5 Qc to tune strategies
Per-signal settlement via x402: agents pay/are paid per tick, feature, or model output
Risk capping: bound exposure by allocating a fixed Qc float across strategies
Data discipline: store bank statements or fills as DataQubes; run privacy-preserving analytics
Hardware trend synergy: as inference gets cheaper (e.g., 4-bit quantization), Qc's micro-pricing aligns with per-token/per-call economics

qriptomedia_unlock: x402 settles Qc and emits a receipt
iQube policy unlocks content + records splits
hft_signal_test: Each candidate signal costs 0.05–0.5 Qc to test & settle via x402
Results and fills logged as DataQubes
Retain winners, kill losers automatically — exposure never exceeds 100 Qc
cross_chain_deferred_mint: Lock source balance + proof on Chain A
Mint on Chain B when needed
Optional reconcile back to A or keep canonical on B
